title: Balochistan govt to present growth oriented budget for next fiscal year: Jam Kamal
content:
ISLAMABAD, Jun 17 (APP): Chief Minister Balochistan Jam Kamal Khan on Thursday said the government was going to present a people-friendly budget for fiscal year 2021-22 in coming days aimed at ensuring provincial socio-economic development with a growth oriented economy.
The government would present over Rs 500 billion budget with a major chunk dedicated for education, health, water and road infrastructure to end the deprivation of the province.
In a video statement, the CM said the government has engaged public in budget making process for the next financial year 2021-22. He said the government was in coordination with departments and reviewed the last three year’s budgets to develop mechanism for formulating new budget.
The government has absolutely focused on addressing issues of public and development of the province, he added.
The government was appreciated by the public which identified the areas of investment in terms of priority which improved the overall soc-economic situation in the province.
The government has sought opinion and suggestions of public through various channels in making financial policies, resource allocation and fund utilization in the province, Jam Kamal said.
The finance department has also conduct a survey for incorporation in the budget of financial year 2021-22 and incorporated public’s recommendations in the budget.
The Balochistan government values the views and suggestions of the masses in framing its policies and prioritizing strategies according to service areas provided by the authority and the need of citizens.
The participation from the citizen in budget making has become a vastly followed practice which also leads to transparency and accountability in resource allocation and utilization.
Jam Kamal said the government has proposed to initiate various new public welfare schemes in the forthcoming budget for providing facilities to the people.
